content:
Still have to get used to Zulip, so hopefully posting to right place.

Hello All! Sorry I missed so much lately, especially important events in Backdrop community. Had good reasons, have been quite busy. Congratulations with successfully conducted Backdrop CMS Live event!
Couldn't participate this time, but hopefully will do next time.

Guys, I need your help. One of Drupal 7 customer projects which we possibly be upgrading to Backdrop has lot's of Shortcut entries. The website editors are used to use that module. So I am trying to bring it back to Backdrop as a contrib module. I've already done initial code convert and pushed it to https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/shortcut.

backdrop-contrib/shortcut
Contribute to backdrop-contrib/shortcut development by creating an account on GitHub.
The converted module generally works great (all the admin and user UI, adding and removing shortcuts), however the Shortcuts are not coming up on UI
I am sure it's because the hook_page_alter() has to be re-worked because the hook was removed from Backdrop. But in this particular case, I am not really sure how it should be re-coded.
Never used it. But where were you hoping these would come up on the UI?
@docwilmot hi! On Drupal 7 it's just under the admin bar: Screen-Shot-2020-09-24-at-4.13.11-PM.png
An idea might be to just add those entries to the Admin Bar?
I'm trying to recall the other alter hook I used in a different module. I'll take a look and post it here @Alan Mels
https://api.backdropcms.org/change-records/new-layout-module-implements-drag-drop-model-building-layouts might help
If it's used to add JS you could use hook_preprocess_page
I dont think there is any neat hook to do this now. For the banner on node previews we create a div in node_preview() and use JS to pop it up at the bottom of the page.

docwilmot said:

An idea might be to just add those entries to the Admin Bar?

Adding some links to admin bar would work for team of admins. The module makes possible for every user to create their own shurtcuts., so admin bar would not work.

Herb said:

I'm trying to recall the other alter hook I used in a different module. I'll take a look and post it here Alan Mels

Thanks, I'll take a look at it.

so admin bar would not work.

If its an unacceptable UI for you then ignore, but technically it should be possible to have a "personalized" Admin Bar "My shortcuts" link.

If all else fails you could put the shortcuts in a block or div or anything that gets it on the page then useJS to pace it up top.

docwilmot said:

so admin bar would not work.

If its an unacceptable UI for you then ignore, but technically it should be possible to have a "personalized" Admin Bar "My shortcuts" link.

If all else fails you could put the shortcuts in a block or div or anything that gets it on the page then useJS to pace it up top.

Using admin bar for all users would implicate permission and possibly some other configuration issues. I believe there was good reason for Drupal to have a seperate module for shortcuts and not just use the admin menu.

If there is no easy way to re-instate on Backdrop how the module worked on Drupal 7, then I'll just use blocks as you suggested. Thanks!

@Alan Mels I wonder if one of these two hooks would work for you:

hook_admin_bar_output_build

hook_admin_bar_output_alter

@Alan Mels

I am sure it's because the hook_page_alter() has to be re-worked because the hook was removed from Backdrop.

See this commit: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/navbar/commit/a9509b01aac824d10c9c2ae6e8016b7eacb2cc86

Move content of shortcut_page_alter() into shortcut_preprocess_page(). · backdrop-contrib/navbar@a9509b0
A mobile friendly navigation toolbar containing top-level administrative components. - backdrop-contrib/navbar
Thanks guys for all the suggestions. I will try them all to rule out the optimal one.

Thank you all for useful links. The Shortcut module has been released on https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/shortcut

backdrop-contrib/shortcut
This module brings back D7's Shortcut module, removed from Backdrop core, as a contributed module. - backdrop-contrib/shortcut
@Alan Mels ++
mels** kudos (Karma: 1)
